description: Chinese [wheat noodles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_noodles#Wheat) (as opposed to [rice noodles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_noodles#Rice)) are made from wheat flour and water, sometimes with salt, and, for [egg noodles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_noodles#Lye-water_or_egg), egg or lye.

word.description: {涼} is *cold*, and {麵} is [noodles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noodle), so {涼麵} is [cold noodles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cold_noodles).

images.place: Shang Artisan Noodles, Las Vegas, Nevada

description: Chinese cold noodles are often assumed to be of the Sichuan variety, but there are other regional varieties with different types of noodles, such as Shanghai cold noodles.

word.description: {撈} is *mix* or *stir*, and {麵} is [noodles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noodle), so {撈麵} is *stirred noodles* (not stir-fried noodles).

description: A staple of Chinese-American eateries, [lo mein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lo_mein) are originally Cantonese noodles made from egg and wheat, tossed and stir-fried with meat and vegetables.
